column4: The JVM takes up about 40-50 megs for the class libraries... java is better for resource intensive applications right now (so IDEs, editor suites, server programs, etc)
The upcoming Java service pack is going to introduce "java kernel" which reduces the initial memor usage to only core classes on startup.... about 2 MB
off-topic, and i don't really care, but thanks
Of course you don't care, you're one of those kinds of people
